meanings.definition: To subject (food) to partial digestion before being eaten.
meanings.sent1: I like to predigest my food by chewing it well before swallowing.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother always told me to predigest my food properly to avoid stomach issues.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to predigest the tough meat by marinating it overnight.
meanings.sent4: She tried to predigest the new information by reading it multiple times.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to predigest the lesson by summarizing it in their own words.

meanings.definition: To simplify or make easier to understand by breaking down complex information.
meanings.sent1: I need to predigest this scientific article before presenting it to the class.
meanings.sent2: The professor predigests the lecture material to help students grasp the concepts better.
meanings.sent3: Trying to predigest the math problem, she drew diagrams to visualize the steps.
meanings.sent4: The book club leader predigests the novel's plot to entice members to read it.
meanings.sent5: To predigest the legal jargon, the lawyer explained the contract in simple terms.
